intro: Zeltnera arizonica, commonly known as the Arizona zeltnera, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, adapting well to harsh desert conditions. Zeltnera arizonica is often found in canyons and along streambanks, where it thrives in partial shade.
